member.name: T:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.FormulaParser
member.summary: The class provides static methods for creating instances. Use the method to create a with default configuration. Use the method to create a that allows to configure the instance.

member.summary: Prevents the usage of scientific notation (e.g. 2e3 = 4000)

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureSupportedFeatures.DisableBracket
member.summary: Prevents the usage of brackets.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureSupportedFeatures.DisablePow
member.summary: Prevents the usage of pow (e.g. 3^2 = 9)

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureSupportedFeatures.DisableVariables
member.summary: Ptevents the usage of variables.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureSupportedFeatures.DisableFunctions
member.summary: Prevents the usage of functions.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureValidationBehavior.DisableVariableNameValidation
member.summary: Diables the validation of variable names when creating a parsing tree.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureValidationBehavior.DisableFunctionNameValidation
member.summary: Diables the validation of functions names when creating a parsing tree.

member.summary: Allows to configure functions of the .
member.param: The object that provides methods for configuring functions of the formula parser.

member.summary: Allows to configure constants of the .
member.param: The object that provides methods for configuring constants of the formula parser.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IFormulaParserBuilder.ConfigureSupportedFeatures(System.Action{ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureSupportedFeatures})
member.summary: Allows to disable features of the .
member.param: The object that provides methods for disabling features of the formula parser.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IFormulaParserBuilder.ConfigureValidationBehavior(System.Action{ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IConfigureValidationBehavior})
member.summary: Allows to configure the validation behavior of the .
member.remarks: The default behavior is, that names of configured functions / provided variables are required. If the formula contains unknown functions / variables, the parsing process fails with an appropriated error message. This method allows to disable validation for variables / functions which may be useful for creating a parsing tree.
member.param: The object that provides methods for disabling features of the formula parser.

member.name: M:ThinkSharp.FormulaParsing.IFormulaParserBuilder.Build
member.summary: Build the configured .
